volo: <entryFree id="n51300" type="main" key="vo^lo3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. volo</etym>, <sense id="n51300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a volunteer</hi>, first applied to the slaves who, after the battle at Cannæ, were enrolled upon their own expressed desire to serve (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">volones dicti sunt milites, qui post Cannensem cladem usque ad octo milia, cum essent servi, voluntarie se ad militiam obtulere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Diac. p. 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volones, quia sponte hoc voluerunt, appellati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus miles tironi, liber voloni sese exaequari sineret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Phil. 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vologessia: <entryFree id="n51301" type="main" key="Vologessi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vologessĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Babylonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kufa</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 23</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vologesocerta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vologesus: <entryFree id="n51302" type="main" key="Vologe_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vologēsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vologēses</orth>, <itype>is or i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several kings of Parthia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the house of the Arsacidœ;</hi> form Vologēsus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:57:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 57, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>; id. <cb n="VOLU" /> Dom. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 123</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Vologēses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volones: <entryFree id="n51303" type="main" key="vo^lo_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlōnes</orth>, v. 3. volo.</entryFree>
volpes: <entryFree id="n51304" type="main" key="volpes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volpes</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volpīnor</orth>, etc., v. vulp-.</entryFree>
volsce: <entryFree id="n51305" type="main" key="Volsce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volsce</orth>, v. Volsci <sense id="n51305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
volscens: <entryFree id="n51306" type="main" key="Volscens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volscens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an officer of the Latins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:420 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 420 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
volsci: <entryFree id="n51307" type="main" key="Volsci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volsci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the most considerable people in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Volsci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Volscians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 22</bibl> sq.; 3, 6 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 10, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:168 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 168 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Volscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Volsci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Volscian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 803</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Volscē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">after the manner of the Volsci</hi>: qui Obsce et Volsce fabulantur: nam Latine nesciunt, Titin. ap. Fest. s. v. obscum, p. 189 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
volscius: <entryFree id="n51308" type="main" key="Volsci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volscĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">Volscius Fictor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volsella: <entryFree id="n51309" type="main" key="volsella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volsella</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vuls-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">volsilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pincers</hi> for pulling out hairs, <hi rend="ital">tweezers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51309.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:28:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 28, 5</bibl>.—As a surgical instrument, <hi rend="ital">forceps</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51309.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnare volsellis, non gladio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>so as to do but little damage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 33</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
volsinii: <entryFree id="n51310" type="main" key="Volsi^ni^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volsĭnĭi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vulsĭnĭi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bolsena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 52, 53, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:191" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 191</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n51310.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Volsĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Volsinii</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 4.—</sense><sense id="n51310.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Volsĭnĭensis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vuls-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Volsinii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Volsinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:32:4:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 32, 4, § 2</bibl></cit>: lacus, <hi rend="ital">a lake lying south of the town</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago di Bolsena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 168</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Volsĭnĭen-ses</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vuls-</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Volsinii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Volsinians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 31 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
volso: <entryFree id="n51311" type="main" key="Volso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. Vulso.</entryFree>
volsura: <entryFree id="n51312" type="main" key="volsu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. vulsura.</entryFree>
volsus: <entryFree id="n51313" type="main" key="volsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of vello.</entryFree>
volt: <entryFree id="n51314" type="main" key="volt"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volt</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voltis</orth>, <itype>old forms for vult, vultis, from volo</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
volta: <entryFree id="n51315" type="gloss" key="Volta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volta</orth>, <sense id="n51315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Etruscan name of a monster among the Volsinians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 53, 54, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volticulus: <entryFree id="n51316" type="main" key="volti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">voltĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. vulticulus.</entryFree>
voltinia: <entryFree id="n51317" type="main" key="Voltini^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Voltinĭa trĭbus</orth>, <sense id="n51317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Roman tribes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of unknown locality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 16, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 418, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">48, 11</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Voltinĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people of the Voltinian tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 17, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
voltumna: <entryFree id="n51318" type="main" key="Voltumna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Voltumna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tutelary goddess of the Etruscan Confederation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in whose temple their general assemblies were held</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 61</bibl>; 5, 17.</sense></entryFree>
voltuosus: <entryFree id="n51319" type="main" key="voltu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">voltŭōsus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voltur</orth>, etc., v. vult-.</entryFree>
volturnus: <entryFree id="n51320" type="main" key="Volturnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volturnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Vulturnus.</entryFree>
voltus: <entryFree id="n51321" type="main" key="voltus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">voltus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, v. vultus.</entryFree>
volubilis: <entryFree id="n51322" type="main" key="vo^lu_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>volvo</etym>, <sense id="n51322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is turned round</hi> or (more freq.) <hi rend="ital">that turns itself round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spinning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whirling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rolling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolving.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51322.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a top</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nexus (anguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volubilis et rotundus deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurae aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">labitur (sc. amnis), et labetur in omne volubilis aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the golden apple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 667</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 20, 209</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">electrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51322.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51322.3" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluble</hi> (the figure taken from rolling waters): <cit><quote lang="la">vis volubilis orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:28:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 28, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotunda volubilisque sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">homo volubilis quādam praecipiti celeritate dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 105</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 617</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n51322.4" n="B" level="2"> Of fate, <hi rend="ital">changeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaga volubilisque fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 26, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videamus tot varietates tam volubili orbe circumagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae volubiles casus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volubilium casuum diritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūbĭ-lĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n51322.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Swiftly rolling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spinning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51322.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">rapidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">volubly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditur numerose et volubiliter oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:210" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 62, 210</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volubilitas: <entryFree id="n51323" type="main" key="vo^lu_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>volubilis</etym>, <sense id="n51323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rapid</hi> <pb n="2012" /> <cb n="VOLU" /> <hi rend="ital">whirling motion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51323.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 19, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:271" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Asclep. p. 100, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51323.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">roundness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round form</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fracta capitis latissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 434</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51323.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51323.4" n="A" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">rapidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">volubility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae volubilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen aliis verborum volubilitasque cordi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 52</bibl></cit> (opp. tarditas); 10, 1, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 20, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51323.5" n="B" level="2"> Of fate, <hi rend="ital">changeableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutability</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod temere fit caeco casu et volubilitate fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 2, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volucer: <entryFree id="n51324" type="main" key="vo^lu^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlŭcer</orth>, <itype>ū^cris, ū^cre</itype> (<sense id="n51324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> volucrium, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 119</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> volucris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:209" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:471" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 471</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> volucer fama, Petr. poët. 123, 210; cf. acer; on the quantity of the <hi rend="ital">u</hi> in volucris, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 28</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. 2. volo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged</hi> (class.; syn.: ales, volatilis). </sense><sense id="n51324.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51324.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dracones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:482" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cupid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:364" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:55" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pes (Mercurii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:88" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 88</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">o nuntium volucrem!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51324.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlū^cris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. avis, once <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, sc. ales: <cit><quote lang="la">teneros volucres, Cic. poët. Div. 2, 30, 64),</quote> <trans><tr>a bird</tr>, <tr>a flying creature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:344" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 344</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit> (4, 6), 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junonis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the peacock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 385</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Junonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Med. Fac. 33</bibl></cit>; of the cock: volucres cecinere diem, Coripp. 1, 199; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:22" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the eagle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tityi volucres,</quote> <trans><tr>vultures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit> (3, 13), 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the sirens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:87" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:13" default="NO">12, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 525</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 308</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucris parvula,</quote> <trans><tr>the fly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51324.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of any thing that moves rapidly, <hi rend="ital">flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. velox): lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 173</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ritu flammarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 795</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:807" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 807</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:602" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 242</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 102</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 544</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 234</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 245</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucri freta classe pererrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam volucrem sequor Te per gramina Martii Campi,</quote> <trans><tr>speeding</tr>, <tr>running</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 38</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n51324.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51324.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">fleet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam volucre quam maledictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 23, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud genus (dicendi) est ... verbis volucre atque incitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucri spe et cogitatione rapiuntur a domo longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51324.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">passing quickly by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transitory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o volucrem fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 28, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 13, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 207</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlŭcrĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">swiftly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapidly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">congregati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perurgebat nocentes innocentesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volucra: <entryFree id="n51325" type="main" key="vo^lu_cra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūcra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>volvo</etym>, <sense id="n51325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of worm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">caterpillar that wraps itself up in vineleaves</hi> (called also convolvulus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 15</bibl>.—It is also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūcre</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 265</bibl>; and <number>plur.</number> volucres, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:333" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 333</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volucre: <entryFree id="n51326" type="main" key="vo^lu_^cre"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlū^cre</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlū^cres</orth>, v. volucra.</entryFree>
volucripes: <entryFree id="n51327" type="main" key="vo^lu_^cri^pe^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlū^crĭ-pĕs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>volucer</etym>, <sense id="n51327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swiftfooted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 21, 14</bibl>; Sid. poët. Ep. 9, 15.</sense></entryFree>
volucris: <entryFree id="n51328" type="main" key="volu_^cris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volū^cris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. volucer, I. 2.</entryFree>
volucritas: <entryFree id="n51329" type="main" key="vo^lu_^cri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlū^crĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>volucer</etym>, <sense id="n51329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swiftness of flight</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volucriter: <entryFree id="n51330" type="main" key="vo^lu_^cri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlū^crĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. volucer <sense id="n51330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
volumen: <entryFree id="n51331" type="main" key="vo^lu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>volvo; a thing that is rolled or wound up; hence</etym>, <sense id="n51331.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A roll of writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a roll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">book</hi>, <hi rend="ital">volume</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">codex, liber): volumen plenum querelae iniquissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis oraculis Chrysippus totum volumen implevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 56, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumen explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeleste Epicuri de regulā et judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evolvere volumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic plura persequi magnitudo voluminis prohibet, Nep. praef. § 8: illa uberius volumine amplecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="VOLU" /> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">evolvere volumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 24</bibl></cit>: volumina <foreign lang="greek">a)pofqegma/twn</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontificum libros, annosa volumina vatum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signata volumina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51331.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., like liber, of a separate portion of a work, <hi rend="ital">a part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">book</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam duobus superioribus (libris) de morte et de dolore dictum est, tertius dies disputationis hoc tertium volumen efficiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedecim volumina epistularum ad Atticum missarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 17, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:14:19 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 14, 19 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51331.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A roll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whirl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wreath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eddy</hi>, etc. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">(anguis) sinuat immensa volumine terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 208</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 85</bibl>; 11, 753; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:599" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 599</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 721</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crurum (equi),</quote> <trans><tr>bendings</tr>, <tr>joints</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumi,</quote> <trans><tr>wreath</tr>, <tr>whirl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 601</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 505</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum,</quote> <trans><tr>revolution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 71</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n51331.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">revolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alteration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortis humanae volumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
voluminosus: <entryFree id="n51332" type="main" key="vo^lu_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>volumen, II.</etym>, <sense id="n51332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of windings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bendings</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">folds</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora anguium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volumnius: <entryFree id="n51333" type="main" key="Volumni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volumnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Volumnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n51333.1" n="1" level="3"> P. Volumnius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman consul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51333.2" n="2" level="3"> L. Volumnius, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who conquered the Samnites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 18</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n51333.3" n="II" level="1"> Volumnia. </sense><sense id="n51333.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Coriolanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51333.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A freed-woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistress of M. Antonius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 24</bibl>; otherwise called Cytheris, v. Cytheris.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Volumnĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">named from Volumnius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 19, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volumnus: <entryFree id="n51334" type="main" key="Vo^lumnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏlumnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏlumna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. volo</etym>, <sense id="n51334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Well-wishers</hi>, tutelary deities of new-born infants, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 21.</sense></entryFree>
voluntarie: <entryFree id="n51335" type="main" key="vo^lunta_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluntārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. voluntarius <sense id="n51335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
voluntarius: <entryFree id="n51336" type="main" key="vo^lunta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluntārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>voluntas</etym>, <sense id="n51336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">willing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of his</hi> or <hi rend="ital">its own free-will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51336.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51336.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <trans><tr>volunteers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 91 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocissimus quisque juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 59, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procurator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est Asinius quidam, senator voluntarius, lectus ipse a se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 13, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51336.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluntārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (milites), <hi rend="ital">volunteers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 19, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aur. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 244</bibl> and 512.—</sense><sense id="n51336.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <trans><tr>suicide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discessus voluntarius sine ullā spe reditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam hoc ipsum ita justum est, quod recte fit, si est voluntarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junonis transitus in urbem nostram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:35" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>growing of itself</tr>, <tr>spontaneous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 90, § 245</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏ-luntārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">voluntarily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 41" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
voluntas: <entryFree id="n51337" type="main" key="vo^luntas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluntas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. volo</etym>, <sense id="n51337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freewill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51337.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51337.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: simul objecta species cujuspiam est, quod bonum videatur, ad id adipiscendum impellit ipsa natura: id cum constanter prudenterque fit, ejusmodi appetitionem Stoici <foreign lang="greek">bou/lhsin</foreign> appellant, nos appellamus voluntatem: <cit><quote lang="la">eam illi putant in solo esse sapiente, quam sic definiunt: Voluntas est, quae quid cum ratione desiderat: quae autem adversus rationem incitata est vehementius, ea libido est vel cupiditas effrenata, quae in omnibus stultis invenitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis est quaeque res publica, qualis ejus aut natura aut voluntas, qui illam regit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium voluntasque multitudinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem voluntatemque suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid esset suae voluntatis ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has patitur poenas peccandi sola voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:208" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit pro ratione voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:223" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 223</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ejus semper voluntatibus non modo cives assenserint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51337.3" n="2" level="3"> Adverbial phrases. </sense><sense id="n51337.4" n="a" level="4"> Suā (alicujus) voluntate, or simply voluntate, <hi rend="ital">of one's own will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one's own accord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntarily</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sponte, ultro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verum esset, suā voluntate sapientem descendere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suā voluntate, nullā vi coactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: dictus filius tuos vostrā<cb n="VOLU" />  voluntate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu coactus es tuā voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc, quod expetis, meā voluntate concedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditus in patriam voluntate omnium concedi videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—Alone: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi voluntate ibis, rapiam te domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod jus vos cogit, id voluntate impetret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequius erat id voluntate fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae civitates voluntate in ditionem venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 38, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51337.5" n="b" level="4"> Ad voluntatem, de, ex voluntate, <hi rend="ital">according to the will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the consent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the desire</hi> of any one: <cit><quote lang="la">ad voluntatem loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>at the will of another</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus et sermo ad aliorum sensum et voluntatem commutandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 11:42" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix tamen sibi de meā voluntate concessum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Att. 4:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud accidit praeter optatum meum, sed valde ex voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pis. 20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Caesaris voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Fam. 13:29:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter legem et sui voluntatem patris studeat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51337.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51337.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Disposition</hi> towards a person or thing, good or bad: <cit><quote lang="la">erratis, si senatum probare ea ... putatis, populum autem esse in aliā voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensā in eum militum voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celans, quā voluntate esset in regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati, qui de ejus voluntate explorarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—And with bona: <cit><quote lang="la">neque bonae voluntatis ullum signum erga nos tyranni habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc mihi prodest bona voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:21:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:3:2" default="NO">5, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:4:1" default="NO">5, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 81, 8</bibl>: non nudum cum bonā voluntate, sed cum facultatibus accedere ad patriae auxilium, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51337.8" n="2" level="3"> More freq. voluntas alone = bona voluntas, <hi rend="ital">good-will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affection</hi> (syn. benignitas): <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas erga Caesarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa in se (with summum studium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena a te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas vestra si ad poëtam accesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularis voluntas Campanae vicinitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansisset eadem voluntas in eorum posteris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n51337.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A last will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensio testamentorum ac voluntatis mortuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 242</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 4, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also ultima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per testamentum aut per aliam quamlibet ultimam voluntatem,</quote> <trans><tr>other expression of his will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51337.10" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sint in dicendo variae voluntates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 21, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quantam voluntatem habent ad hunc opprimendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 18, 40</bibl></cit> (14, 30).— </sense><sense id="n51337.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to 1. volo, I. E. 4. b.), of speech, <hi rend="ital">meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">import</hi> (only post-Aug.; esp. freq. in Quint.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. vis): verbis legum standum sit an voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; so (opp. verba) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:5:4" default="NO">7, 5, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio juris omnis aut verborum proprietate aut voluntatis conjectura continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:9" default="NO">6, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum vi aut voluntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, praef. 10: <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volup: <entryFree id="n51338" type="main" key="vo^lu^p"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlŭp</orth> (incorrectly <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlŭpē</orth> in some edd.; cf. Opusc. Phil. 2, p. 450 sqq. Ritschl), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>shortened for volupis; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)lpi/s</foreign>; cf. voluptas</etym>, <sense id="n51338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">agreeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfactorily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to one's satisfaction</hi>, etc. (opp. aegre; <cit><quote lang="la">ante-class.): si illis aegre est mihi quod volup est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid clam uxorem suo animo fecit volup, id. As. grex, 1: scio, ut tibi ex me sit volup,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudeo et volup est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volup est (like aegre est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 5</bibl> Don.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volupia: <entryFree id="n51339" type="main" key="Vo^lu^pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏlŭpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>volup</etym>, <sense id="n51339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of Pleasure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:34:45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 34, 45</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
voluptabilis: <entryFree id="n51340" type="main" key="vo^lupta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>voluptas</etym>, <sense id="n51340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that causes pleasure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">satisfaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi> (ante-class. and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 75, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
voluptarie: <entryFree id="n51341" type="main" key="vo^lupta_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. voluptarius <sense id="n51341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
voluptarius: <entryFree id="n51342" type="main" key="vo^lupta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptārĭus</orth> (post-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptŭārĭus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 144</bibl>; Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 92), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>voluptas</etym>, <sense id="n51342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging</hi> <pb n="2013" /> <cb n="VOLU" /> <hi rend="ital">to pleasure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enjoyment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightful; devoted to pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sensual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluptuous</hi>: quamquam Stoici communi nomine corporis et animi <foreign lang="greek">h(donh\n</foreign> appellant, ego malo laetitiam appellare quasi gestientis animi elationem voluptariam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 10, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res (with amoenae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustatus, qui est sensus ex omnibus maxime voluptarius,</quote> <trans><tr>susceptible of enjoyment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus, homo, ut scis, voluptarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a man devoted to pleasure</tr>, <tr>a voluptuary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem mollem, quem voluptarium dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 54</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptarii atque potatores maximi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptaria, delicata, mollis disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationes,</quote> <trans><tr>concerning sensual enjoyment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">voluptuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transactis paucis noctibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
voluptas: <entryFree id="n51343" type="main" key="vo^luptas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n51343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> voluptatum and -tium), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/lpw</foreign>, to hope; root <foreign lang="greek">velp-</foreign>; cf. volo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">satisfaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoyment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight</hi> (whether sensual or spiritual; syn. oblectamentum). </sense><sense id="n51343.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51343.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omne id, quo gaudemus, voluptas est, ut omne, quo offendimur, dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic verbo (voluptatis) omnes qui Latine sciunt, duas res subiciunt, laetitiam in animo, commotionem suavem jucunditatis in corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas quae percipitur ex libidine et cupiditate (syn. jucunditas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla capitalior pestis quam voluptas corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tuis litteris cepi una cum omnibus incredibilem voluptatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero sum inscius, esse utilitatem in historiā, non modo voluptatem. Quid? cum fictas fabulas ... cum voluptate legimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frui voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 84</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">novum denique officium instituit a voluptatibus, an officer in the imperial household,</quote> <trans><tr>master of the revels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n51343.3" n="B" level="2"> Personified, Voluptas, as a deity, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51343.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51343.5" n="A" level="2"> Of persons, as a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">mea voluptas,</quote> <trans><tr>my joy</tr>, <tr>my charmer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">care puer, mea sera et sola voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 581</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51343.6" n="B" level="2"> Voluptates, <hi rend="ital">sports</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectacles</hi>, given to the people, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne minimo quidem temporis voluptates intermissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prob. 19</bibl>; Treb. Gall. 9 al. —</sense><sense id="n51343.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The desire for pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam voluptatem explere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 19</bibl>; cf. Gell. praef. § 14.—</sense><sense id="n51343.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The male semen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
voluptativus: <entryFree id="n51344" type="hapax" key="vo^lupta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>voluptas</etym>, <sense id="n51344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to enjoyment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
voluptificus: <entryFree id="n51345" type="hapax" key="vo^lupti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>voluptasfacio</etym>, <sense id="n51345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that causes enjoyment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gives delight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella Veneris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 348, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
voluptuarius: <entryFree id="n51346" type="main" key="vo^luptu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. voluptarius <sense id="n51346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
voluptuose: <entryFree id="n51347" type="main" key="vo^luptu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. voluptuosus <sense id="n51347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
voluptuosus: <entryFree id="n51348" type="main" key="vo^luptu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏluptŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>voluptas</etym>, <sense id="n51348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of gratification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoyment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasure</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">delight; agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightful</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 260" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 260</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contionator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlup-tŭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with pleasure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delight</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 20</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
volusenus: <entryFree id="n51349" type="main" key="Voluse_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volusēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <sense id="n51349.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">C. Volusenus Quadratus,</quote> <trans><tr>a tribune of the soldiers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volusius: <entryFree id="n51350" type="main" key="Volusi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volusĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n51350.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Volusius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n51350.2" n="2" level="3"> Volusius, <hi rend="ital">an old poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who wrote</hi> Annales, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:95:7" default="NO" valid="yes">95, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51350.3" n="3" level="3"> Volusius Maecianus, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated lawyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the tutor of Marcus Antoninus</hi>, Jul. Capit. in Ant. Pio, 12 al.</sense></entryFree>
volustana: <entryFree id="n51351" type="main" key="Volusta_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Volustāna</orth>, ōrum. <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n51351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name of the Montes Cambunii in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
voluta: <entryFree id="n51352" type="main" key="vo^lu_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>volvo</etym>, <sense id="n51352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a volute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spiral scroll</hi>, as an ornament on the capitals of columns, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volutabrum: <entryFree id="n51353" type="main" key="vo^lu_ta_brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūtābrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>voluto</etym>, <sense id="n51353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wallowing-place</hi> for swine. <hi rend="ital">a hog-pool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 411</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 1, p. 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 224</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Pet. 2. 22. <cb n="VOLU" /></sense></entryFree>
volutabundus: <entryFree id="n51354" type="hapax" key="vo^lu_ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>voluto</etym>, <sense id="n51354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wallowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rolling about</hi>: libidinosus et volutabundus in voluptatibus, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 491, 16</bibl> (Rep. 2, 41, 68).</sense></entryFree>
volutatio: <entryFree id="n51355" type="main" key="vo^lu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rolling about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wallowing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51355.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51355.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">totis volutationibus corporis aliquid persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverea athletarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecā quādam volutatione contrahi undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51355.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51355.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-Aug.). * </sense><sense id="n51355.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Restlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nusquam residentis animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n51355.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Instability</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta rerum humanarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volutatus: <entryFree id="n51356" type="main" key="vo^lu_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rolling about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wallowing</hi> (post-Aug.): pulvis volutatu collectus, Phn. 10, 4, 5, § 17.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volutatibus pulvereis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 144, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volutim: <entryFree id="n51357" type="gloss" key="vo^lu_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>volvo</etym>, = volubiliter, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 4, 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
volutina: <entryFree id="n51358" type="main" key="Vo^lu_ti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏlūtīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess who presides over the husks of corn-ears</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
