voluto: <entryFree id="n51359" type="main" key="vo^lu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twist</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tumble about.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51359.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51359.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51359.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n51359.4" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoras per terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus (ventus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 412</bibl></cit>: pilas e fimo pedibus. i. e. <hi rend="ital">to form by rolling together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 98</bibl>; cf. volvo, I.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in pulvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to roll about</tr>, <tr>wallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 16, 53, § 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51359.5" n="b" level="4"> More freq., mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut gallinae possint in pulvere volutari,</quote> <trans><tr>roll themselves</tr>, <tr>roll</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus caenoso lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super aureorum acervos ... toto corpore volutatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volutati supra jacentia poma (irenacei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in allusion to the lit. signif. of the name Verres: quem (Verrem) in luto volutatum totius corporis vestigiis invenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animi) corporibus elapsi circum terram ipsam volutantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 26, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tibi pueri ad pedes volutarentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 24, 33</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua amplexus genibusque volutans Haerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(amnis) per cava saxa volutans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sacco et cinere volutantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n51359.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:16:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51359.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to roll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roll about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roll along</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to roll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wallow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51359.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem per ampla atria,</quote> <trans><tr>to roll</tr>, <tr>spread</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 725</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 98</bibl></cit>: confusa verba. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 55</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: cum omnes in omni genere et scelerum et flagitiorum volutentur,</quote> <trans><tr>wallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni dedecore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter mala plurima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 24:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 24, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51359.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51359.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To busy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi> (of the mind): <cit><quote lang="la">animum saepe tacitis cogitationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in veteribus scriptis studiose et multum volutatum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 10, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51359.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To turn over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">revolve</hi> in the mind; <hi rend="ital">to consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladios in comisationem praeparatos volutabam in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec secum volutantem in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc eum jam pridem volutare in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in animo voluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in pectore volutare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse quid intra animum volutaverim ... omittam referre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil umquam nisi sempiternum et divinum animo volutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud atque aliud consilium animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 11:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitus mecum ipse voluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter seque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa secum animo volutans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec secum volutans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secum corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo cum corde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in secreto cum amicis,</quote> <trans><tr>to consider</tr>, <tr>discuss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia de Romano bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 60, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus suā sponte volutantibus res inter se repugnantes obtorpuerant animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51359.12" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to roll</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumble one's self</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">leone obvio suppliciter volutante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 56</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 140</bibl> (cf. I. A. 1. b. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> supra).</sense></entryFree>
volutus: <entryFree id="n51360" type="main" key="vo^lu_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of volvo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51361" type="hapax" key="vo^lu_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>volvo</etym>, <sense id="n51361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rolling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the power of rolling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twisting</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">turning</hi> <cb n="VOLV" /> <hi rend="ital">about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedit volatus avibus, volutus serpentibus, cursus feris, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 348, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volva: <entryFree id="n51362" type="main" key="volva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volva</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vulva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>volvo</etym>, <sense id="n51362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrapper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integument.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51362.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fungorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the seed-covering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 104" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 104 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n51362.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the womb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matrix</hi> of women and she-animals (syn. uterus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 21</bibl>; 5, 25 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:61:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 61, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:35 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 35 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">A sow's matrix</hi>, as a very favorite dish, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 210</bibl>; Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:56:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 56, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volvo: <entryFree id="n51363" type="main" key="volvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volvo</orth>, <itype>volvi, vŏlūtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n51363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> volvier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 714</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. varas, circumference; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)lu/w</foreign>, to wrap; root <foreign lang="greek">vel-</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to roll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumble</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n51363.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51363.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(amnis) volvit sub undis Grandia saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 288</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 529</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:173" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen lapides volvens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beluas cum fluctibus (procellae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 3, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vortices (flumen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumum caligine (ventus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos huc illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos per singula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=114" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 114</bibl></cit> Müll. volvendi sunt libri, <hi rend="ital">to unroll</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">open</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:87:298" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 87, 298</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrrhena carmina retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 381</bibl></cit> (hence, volumen, in the signif. of roll, book, volume, v. h. v. I.): <cit><quote lang="la">semineces volvit multos,</quote> <trans><tr>rolls in the dust</tr>, <tr>fells to the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 329</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n51363.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51363.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To roll up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form by rolling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 30, § 99</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui terga dederant, conversi in hostem volventesque orbem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>forming a circle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam orbem volventes suos increpans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 28, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51363.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To breathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhale</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vitalis aëris auras Volvere in ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(equus) Collectumque fremens volvit sub naribus ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51363.6" n="3" level="3"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roll itself round about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roll along</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis caenum teterrima quom sit Spurcities, eadem subus haec jucunda videtur, Insatiabiliter toti ut volvantur ibidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:978" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 978</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (anguis) inter vestes et levia pectora lapsus Volvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cylindrum volvi et versari turbinem putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi qui volvuntur stellarum cursus sempiterni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excussus curru moribundus volvitur arvis,</quote> <trans><tr>rolls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volvi humi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volvitur Euryalus leto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae volvuntur inanes,</quote> <trans><tr>roll</tr>, <tr>flow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 449</bibl></cit>.— <mood>Part.</mood>: <cit><quote lang="la">volventia plaustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 163</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51363.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to roll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roll along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roll off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">onwards</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n51363.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">volvere curarum tristes in pectore fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnos fluctus irarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentes iras in pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot volvere casus Insignem pietate virum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to undergo so many misfortunes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis diu saxum hoc volvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9</bibl></cit> (8), 55: <cit><quote lang="la">(lunam) celerem pronos Volvere menses,</quote> <trans><tr>in rolling on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volvendis mensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has omnis (animas) ubi mille rotam volvere per annos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>completed the cycle</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 748</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volventibus annis,</quote> <trans><tr>with revolving years</tr>, <tr>after the lapse of years</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 234</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volventia lustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:928" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 928</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volvens annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fata deum rex Sortitur volvitque vices,</quote> <trans><tr>fixes the series of revolving events</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 376</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic volvere Parcas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Pontidius celeriter sane verba volvens,</quote> <trans><tr>rolling off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:246" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 70, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententias facile verbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 81, 280</bibl></cit> longissima est complexio verborum, quae volvi uno spiritu potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne verba traic amus aperte, quo melius aut cadat aut volvatur oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>be rounded</tr>, <tr>form periods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:229" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 69, 229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51363.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to turn over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">revolve</hi> in the mind; <hi rend="ital">to ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi> (cf. verso): <cit><quote lang="la">multa cum animo suo volvebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:108:3" default="NO" valid="yes">108, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 32, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 113:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 113, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa omnia animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 49, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has inanium rerum inanes ipsas volventes cogitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 28, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 60, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:3" default="NO">5, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum adversus nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fauni sub pectore sortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 254</bibl></cit>: haec illis volventibus tandem vicit fortuna <pb n="2014" /> <cb n="VOMI" /> reipublicae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 41, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subinde hoc in animo volve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretas cogitationes intra se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo ut plerumque intra me ipsum volvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna tecum volvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">mente aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 60, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
volvola: <entryFree id="n51364" type="main" key="volvo^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volvŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> convolvulus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Naum. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
volvula: <entryFree id="n51365" type="hapax" key="volvu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">volvŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vulv-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>volva</etym>, <sense id="n51365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little womb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">matrix</hi> of an animal, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vomax: <entryFree id="n51366" type="hapax" key="vo^max"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vomo</etym>, <sense id="n51366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">given to vomiting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil bibacius, vomacius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vomer: <entryFree id="n51367" type="main" key="vo_mer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōmer</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype> (collat. form of the <sense id="n51367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vōmis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 26</bibl>; v. Heins. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F, 4, 927</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 292</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a ploughshare.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51367.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 40, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:927" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 927</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 671</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51367.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51367.3" n="A" level="2"> = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1269</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51367.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A style</hi> for writing with, Atta ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vomica: <entryFree id="n51368" type="main" key="vo^mi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭca</orth> (<sense id="n51368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">o</hi> scanned long, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 40, 743</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vomo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a sore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ulcer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imposthume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abscess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encysted tumor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51368.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 28, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 244</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 186, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51368.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of stones, <hi rend="ital">a bunch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knob filled with fluid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 32, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 2, 10, § 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51368.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an evil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoyance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plague</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curse</hi> (very rare. and censured as low by Quint.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>): hostis, Romani, si expellere vultis, vomica quae gentium venit longe, Apollini vovendos censeo ludos, qui, etc., an old prophecy ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12, 9</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quaedam et humiles translationes et sordidae: non enim si Cicero recte Sentinam reipublicae dixit, foeditatem hominum significans, idcirco probem illud quoque veteris oratoris, Persecuisti reipublicae vomicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Augustus) Agrippam nepotem et Julias, filiam et neptem, omnibus probris contaminatas appellare solebat tres vomicas aut tria carcinomata sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vomicosus: <entryFree id="n51369" type="main" key="vo^mi^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vomica</etym>, <sense id="n51369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sores</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:17:102" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 17, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vomicus: <entryFree id="n51370" type="hapax" key="vo^mi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ulcerous;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
vomificus: <entryFree id="n51371" type="main" key="vo^mi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vomo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n51371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that causes vomiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>an emetic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:4:32" default="NO">3, 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vomifluus: <entryFree id="n51372" type="main" key="vo^mi^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vomica-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n51372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing with pus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">matter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">passio (i. e. morbus),</quote> <trans><tr>a discharge of matter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:200" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 200</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vomis: <entryFree id="n51373" type="main" key="vo_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōmis</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, v. vomer.</entryFree>
vomitio: <entryFree id="n51374" type="main" key="vo^mi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vomo</etym>, <sense id="n51374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spewing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vomiting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51374.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 117, § 282</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:144" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 20, 83, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:132" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 64, § 132</bibl>; 26, 7, 25, § 41 al.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭtĭum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 136</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n51374.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">that which is vomited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vomit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">varii colores vomitionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vomito: <entryFree id="n51375" type="main" key="vo^mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n51375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to vomit often</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:83:24" default="NO">83, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:108:37" default="NO">108, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo vomitandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vomitor: <entryFree id="n51376" type="hapax" key="vo^mi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who vomits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vomiter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejuni vomitores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vomitorius: <entryFree id="n51377" type="main" key="vo^mi^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that provokes vomiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vomitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vomitory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emetic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51377.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bulbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 41, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:128" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 19, 75, § 128</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51377.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭ-tōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the entrances</hi> to the theatres or amphitheatres, <hi rend="ital">vomitories</hi> (which led to the places where the people sat), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vomitus: <entryFree id="n51378" type="main" key="vo^mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vomiting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51378.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmoneum vomitum vomere,</quote> <trans><tr>to spit up the lungs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam vomitu egerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 23, 44, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 6, 23, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 68, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n51378.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">that which is thrown up by vomiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vomit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:86" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 27, § 86</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virides et nigri vomitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>.—To denote <hi rend="ital">a disgusting<cb n="VORA" />  fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a puke</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vomo: <entryFree id="n51379" type="main" key="vo^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n51379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. vām-ami, vomit; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)me/w</foreign>; root <foreign lang="greek">vem</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n51379.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to puke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vomit</hi> (a common method among the Romans of renewing the appetite). </sense><sense id="n51379.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vomere post cenam te velle dixisses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Dejot. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mensam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—With a homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">vomitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab horā tertiā bibebatur, ludebatur, vomebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51379.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to pour forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>: quā largius vomit (Padus), <hi rend="ital">discharges itself</hi> into the sea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 119</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51379.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discharge by vomiting; to vomit up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi> (cf.: eructo, nauseo). </sense><sense id="n51379.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 84, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene intestina sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51379.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to vomit forth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pour out in abundance; to emit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(Charybdis) vomit fluctus totidem totidemque resorbet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 682</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminas flammas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel (apes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <trans><tr>to breathe out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:828" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 828</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <trans><tr>to give up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armataeque vomunt stridentia tela fenestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:536" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguem nebulam vomuere lucernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:181" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 181</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vonones: <entryFree id="n51380" type="main" key="Vo^no_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏnōnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a king of Parthia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 68</bibl>; cf. Suet. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51380.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another king of the same name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vopiscus: <entryFree id="n51381" type="main" key="vo^piscus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏpiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of a pair of twins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born alive after the premature birth and death of the other</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vopiscos appellabant a geminis, qui retenti utero nascerentur, altero interempto abortu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 10, 8, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 557, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51382" type="main" key="Vo^piscus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏpiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. vopiscus</etym>, <sense id="n51382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>. </sense><sense id="n51382.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Julius Vopiscus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51382.2" n="II" level="1"> Flavius Vopiscus, <hi rend="ital">an historian in the time of Constantine the Great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who wrote the lives of several Roman emperors.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vopte: <entryFree id="n51383" type="main" key="vopte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vopte</orth> <itype>pro vos ipsi Cato posuit</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
voracitas: <entryFree id="n51384" type="main" key="vo^ra_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏrācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vorax</etym>, <sense id="n51384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greediness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravenousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voracity</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n51384.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingluvie et voracitate notabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51384.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of fire: <cit><quote lang="la">avidissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 107, 111, § 239</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
voraciter: <entryFree id="n51385" type="main" key="vo^ra_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏrācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vorax <sense id="n51385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
voraginosus: <entryFree id="n51386" type="main" key="vo^ra_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏrāgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vorago</etym>, <sense id="n51386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of pits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chasms</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">abysses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voraginous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum, Auct. B. Hisp. 29: via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vorago: <entryFree id="n51387" type="main" key="vo^ra_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏrāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>voro</etym>, <sense id="n51387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abyss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whirlpool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chasm.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51387.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of watery depths: <cit><quote lang="la">summersus equus voraginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastāque voragine gurges Aestuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 296</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicet se Cotta, si potest, ex hac voragine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 55</bibl></cit>.—Of a gulf or chasm in the earth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 2</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a devouring maw or stomach: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:843" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 843</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51387.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos geminae voragines scopulique rei publicae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gulfs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges et vorago patrimonii,</quote> <trans><tr>devourer</tr>, <tr>squanderer</tr>, <tr>spendthrift</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 52, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vorago aut gurges vitiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>abyss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 9, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia, manifestae praedae avidissima vorago,</quote> <trans><tr>abyss</tr>, <tr>gulf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
vorator: <entryFree id="n51388" type="main" key="vo^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a devourer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jejun. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 19, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
voratrina: <entryFree id="n51389" type="main" key="vo^ra_tri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏrātrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n51389.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An eatinghouse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51389.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abyss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chasm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
voratus: <entryFree id="n51390" type="main" key="vo^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n51390.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The devouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (late Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 5, 4.—</sense><sense id="n51390.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A chasm</hi>, Facund. Def. 12, 3.</sense></entryFree>
vorax: <entryFree id="n51391" type="main" key="vo^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏrax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swallowing greedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravenous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voracious</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n51391.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Charybdis tam vorax?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51391.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">devouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consuming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruinous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:687" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 181</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:839" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 839</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part.: culus, <hi rend="ital">lecherous</hi>,<cb n="VOTU" />  <hi rend="ital">lustful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 33, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏrācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">greedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voraciously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
voro: <entryFree id="n51392" type="main" key="vo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root gar-, to swallow; Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">bor-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">bibrw/skw</foreign>, to devour; cf. also gramen</etym>, <sense id="n51392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swallow whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eat greedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devour</hi> (cf. absorbeo). </sense><sense id="n51392.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalium alia vorant, alia mandunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 71, 91, § 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulum (balaena),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edim atque ambabus malis expletis vorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella avide (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucrina (ostrea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:11:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: resinam ex melle Aegyptiam vorato, salvum feceris, <hi rend="ital">swallow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gulp down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi>, as medicine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 31</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of medicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:88:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 88, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:24" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 24</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">meus hic est: hamum vorat,</quote> <trans><tr>swallows</tr>, <tr>takes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 21</bibl>; cf.: hamum voras, Ambros. Tob. n. 7.—</sense><sense id="n51392.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51392.3" n="1" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to devour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swallow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vorat haec (Charybdis) raptas revomitque carinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem (rapidus vortex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 117</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina (vortex pugnae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:230" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus (ulcus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: viam, <hi rend="ital">to finish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perform quickly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 35, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracia quinque vadis Istrum vorat Amphitrite,</quote> <trans><tr>takes in</tr>, <tr>swallows up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 337</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51392.4" n="2" level="3"> Of property, <hi rend="ital">to use up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem in reliquis generis ejus (murrhinorum vasorum) quantum voraverit, licet existimare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51392.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to devour</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to acquire with eagerness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue passionately</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 11, 2</bibl></cit>. —In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:80:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 80, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:51:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 51, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:15" default="NO">7, 67, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51392.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To consume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor vorat tectas penitus medullas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 282" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 282</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:642" default="NO">642</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vorsipellis: <entryFree id="n51393" type="main" key="vorsipellis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vorsipellis</orth>, v. versipellis.</entryFree>
vorso: <entryFree id="n51394" type="main" key="vorso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vorso, vorsōrĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vorsum</orth>, etc., v. vers-.</entryFree>
vortex: <entryFree id="n51395" type="main" key="vortex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vortex, vortĭcōsus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vorto</orth>, etc., v. vert-.</entryFree>
vos: <entryFree id="n51396" type="main" key="vos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vos</orth>, <sense id="n51396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>, v. tu.</sense></entryFree>
vosegus: <entryFree id="n51397" type="main" key="Vo^se^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏsĕgus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏsăgus</orth>, <itype>and, less correctly</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vŏgĕsus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chain of mountains in Gaul</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Vosges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 397</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2072</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
voster: <entryFree id="n51398" type="main" key="voster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">voster</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, v. vester.</entryFree>
votifer: <entryFree id="n51399" type="main" key="vo_ti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōtĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>votum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n51399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vow-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">votive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:92" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 6, 87, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
votivitas: <entryFree id="n51400" type="main" key="vo_ti_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōtīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>votivus</etym>, <sense id="n51400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a solemn promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
votivus: <entryFree id="n51401" type="main" key="vo_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>votum</etym>. <sense id="n51401.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a vow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promised by a vow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">given in consequence of a vow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">votive</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 205</bibl></cit>: legatio, <hi rend="ital">which was undertaken</hi> (often as a mere pretext) <hi rend="ital">to fulfil a vow in a province</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:62" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28, 62</bibl></cit> (3, 26, 16).—</sense><sense id="n51401.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Conformable to one's wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wished for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longed for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desired</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">conspectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 193, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 216, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 167, 32: mors, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 330: constabat, votivum, illi fuisse, quod, etc., Treb. Gall. 3.</sense></entryFree>
voto: <entryFree id="n51402" type="main" key="vo^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏto</orth>, <itype>archaic form of veto</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 56</bibl>.</entryFree>
votum: <entryFree id="n51403" type="main" key="vo_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>voveo</etym>. <sense id="n51403.0" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to voveo, I.) <hi rend="ital">A solemn promise made to some deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vow</hi> (freq. and class.; esp. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">qui (deus) numquam nobis occurrit neque in optatis neque in votis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefaria vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 68, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne animadvertis ex tot tabulis pictis, quam multi votis vim tempestatis effugerint?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:37:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voto et promisso teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstrictum esse religione voti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligari voti sponsione deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de illo aegroto vota faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 15, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:2 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuncupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 594</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debere diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:55:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 55, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovi reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere et solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 35</bibl></cit> (44): <cit><quote lang="la">persolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 100</bibl></cit> (101): <cit><quote lang="la">voto se exsolvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: voti damnari, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to obtain one's prayer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wish</hi> <pb n="2015" /> <cb n="VOX" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 45, 8</bibl>; v. Zumpt, Gram. § 447 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti liberari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51403.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51403.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A thing solemnly promised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which is vowed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">devoted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a volive offering</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">lustramurque Jovi, votisque incendimus aras,</quote> <trans><tr>with burnt-offerings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Danai in voto (i. e. equo Trojano) latent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">iste ... de bonis illius in aede Veneris argenteum Cupidinem posuit. Sic etiam fortunis hominum abutebatur ad nocturna vota cupiditatum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51403.3" n="b" level="4"> Vota, <hi rend="ital">a day on which vows were made for the good of the State</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:233:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 233, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51403.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51403.5" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to voveo, II.) <hi rend="ital">A wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire, longing, prayer</hi> (perh not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ea esse vota, eam esse voluntatem omnium, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus me compotem voti facere vos potestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam res Romana contra spem votaque ejus velut resurgeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 45, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 42, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnibus votis petendum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 21, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnarum cogitationum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivere di mea vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec loca sunt voto fertiliora tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">votum in amante novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti potens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnium sit votum parentum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota parentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: id enim voto meo sufficit; <cit><quote lang="la">illud supra votum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Darius votum meum implevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:8" default="NO">4, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Polyb. 10:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Polyb. 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctis super vota fluentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:30:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 30, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">votum aliquem confodiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc erat in votis: modus agri non ita magnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in voto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:48" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc votum est et rara felicitas,</quote> <trans><tr>is rather a thing to be wished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 6</bibl></cit> Spald.; so, votum est, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">it is to be wished that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an venit in votum Attalicis ex urbibus una?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine votis: O rus, quando ego te aspiciam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 59</bibl></cit>. —Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">alioquin vota arborum frugumque communia sunt nivis diutinas sedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51403.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A marriage vow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matrimonial engagement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marriage</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad tertia vota migrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptualia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 154, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 342, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
votus: <entryFree id="n51404" type="main" key="vo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of voveo.</entryFree>
voveo: <entryFree id="n51405" type="main" key="vo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>vōvi, vōtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <sense id="n51405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to vow</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to promise solemnly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sacredly; to devote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dedicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrate</hi> something to a deity (syn.: promitto, recipio, dico, dedico). </sense><sense id="n51405.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Herculi quisquam decumam vovit umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua capita pro salute patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tullus in re trepidā decem vovit Salios fanaque Pallori ac Pavori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi hinc decimam partem praedae voveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum Junoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota vovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota puer solvit, quae femina voverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votum pro militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19, 28</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sues puer pasceret, unā ex iis amissā vovisse dicitur, si recuperavisset, uvam se deo daturum, quae maxima esset in vineā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:55:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 55, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut pro victimis homines immolant aut se immolaturos vovent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
