G. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me inferre Veneri vovi jam jentaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator ludos magnos vovit Vejis captis se facturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos donaque facturum vovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 28, 9</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 3, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at earum templa sunt publice vota et dedicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro reditu victima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrrheno vindemia regi (Mezentio),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>solemnly promised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:893" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 893</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus leviter pandata, qualis voventium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51405.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (from the wish implied in every vow), <hi rend="ital">to wish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wish for</hi> a thing (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> rare, and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. opto): elige, quid voveas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae modo voverat, odit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid voveat dulci nutricula majus alumno?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tua sim voveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae voveam, duo sunt: minimo ut relevere labore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:675" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 675</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vox: <entryFree id="n51406" type="main" key="vox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vox</orth>, <itype>vōcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>voco</etym>, <sense id="n51406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a voice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tone</hi>, <cb n="VULG" /> <hi rend="ital">cry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51406.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes voces hominis, ut nervi in fidibus, ita sonant, ut a motu animi quoque sunt pulsae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsurge praeco ... Exerce vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">set comprimunda vox mihi atque oratio'st,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I must hold my peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulceribus vocis via saepta coïbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1148</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (faucium) vitio et frangitur et obscuratur et exasperatur et scinditur vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira est quaedam natura vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (eloquentia) constet e voce atque motu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox inflexa ad miserabilem sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclinata ululantique voce canere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem Voconiam magnā voce et bonis lateribus suasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">magnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: 1, 9, 76: summa <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 8</bibl>: sedata et depressa. Auct. <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> S, 12, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremebunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum ita resonans, ut usque Romam significationes vocesque referantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem late nemora alta remittunt,</quote> <trans><tr>echo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:929" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 929</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nostrorum militum vocibus nonnihil carperetur,</quote> <trans><tr>cries</tr>, <tr>shouts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">enimvero voce'st opus: Nausistrata, exi,</quote> <trans><tr>I must exert my voice</tr>, <tr>must call out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 92</bibl></cit>.— Of inanimate things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ad sonitum vocis (i. e. remorum) vestigia torsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fractae voces (maris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 556</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 519</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 524</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n51406.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51406.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which is uttered by the voice</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proverb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maxim</hi> (syn.: vocabulum, verbum); <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">dico, Epicurum non intellegere, quid sonet haec vox voluptatis, id est, quae res huic voci subiciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Platonis vera et tibi certe non inaudita vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc sententiam significare videtur Laconis illa vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl></cit>; so, <foreign lang="greek">no/hma</foreign>, quā voce omnis intellectus accipi potest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is verbi sensus, vis ea vocis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:484" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem pro aliquo mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 19, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vox populi Romani majestate indigna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est positum in voce simplice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescit vox missa reverti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitue, nihil esse opis in hac voce: civis Romanus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:65:section=168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 65, § 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego cum Graecos facerem ... Versiculos, vetuit tali me voce Quirinus: In silvam non ligna feras, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderā excantata voce Thessalā,</quote> <trans><tr>incantation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulum voci atque imperio non oboedire,</quote> <trans><tr>command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 8, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unā voce,</quote> <trans><tr>unanimously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illius nefarii gladiatoris voces percrebuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non igitur ex singulis vocibus philosophi spectandi sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>sayings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex percunctatione nostrorum vocibusque Gallorum ac mercatorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces per vinum, somnum. etc. ... emissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus Veneris Vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliosae,</quote> <trans><tr>abusive expressions</tr>, <tr>abuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt verba et voces, quibus hunc lenire dolorem Possis,</quote> <trans><tr>sayings</tr>, <tr>maxims</tr>, <tr>doctrines</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populum falsis Dedocet uti Vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deripere lunam vocibus,</quote> <trans><tr>with charms</tr>, <tr>incantations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 78</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sacrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marsae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51406.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">language</hi>, in gen., = sermo (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">cultus hominum recentum Voce formasti catus (Mercurius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graiā scierit sive Latinā Voce loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum civem ex voce cognovisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51406.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Accent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa natura ... in omni verbo posuit acutam vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rustica vox et agrestis quosdam delectat,</quote> <trans><tr>pronunciation</tr>, <tr>accent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulcanus: <entryFree id="n51407" type="main" key="Vulca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulcānus</orth>, v. Volcanus.</entryFree>
vulgaris: <entryFree id="n51408" type="main" key="vulga_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgāris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <itype>e</itype> (ante- and postclass. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgārius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, Afran., Nov., and Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 488, 26 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:18" default="NO">3, 16, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:10:6" default="NO">12, 10, 6</bibl>; 16, 5, 1), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vulgus</etym>, <sense id="n51408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the great mass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every-day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonplace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vulgar</hi> (freq. and class.): in omni arte, cujus usus vulgaris communisque non <cb n="VULG" /> sit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in communi vitā et vulgari hominum consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgaris popularisque sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exlended to all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgaria et obsoleta sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 18, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgari et pervagatā declamatione contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 19, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pervagatum et vulgare videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:195" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 57, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam vile neque tam vulgare est, cujus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commendatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunus raro stomachus vulgaria temnit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coetus vulgares spernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prostratas arbores restitui ... vulgare est,</quote> <trans><tr>is a common thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 57, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:120" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 19, 24, § 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10</bibl></cit> 1, 9, No <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> — <orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgā-rĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">after the ordinary</hi> or <hi rend="ital"> common manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vulgarly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">non vulgariter nec ambitiose scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:69:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 69, 1</bibl></cit> (dub.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5</bibl>, §§ 13 and 28; 28, 14, 58, § 204.</sense></entryFree>
vulgaritas: <entryFree id="n51409" type="main" key="vulga_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgārĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vulgaris</etym>, <sense id="n51409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the great mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the multitude</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 123</bibl> and 155.<</sense></entryFree>
vulgariter: <entryFree id="n51410" type="main" key="vulga_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgārĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vulgaris <sense id="n51410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vulgarius: <entryFree id="n51411" type="main" key="vulga_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. vulgaris <sense id="n51411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vulgate: <entryFree id="n51412" type="main" key="vulga_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. vulgo, <sense id="n51412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vulgator: <entryFree id="n51413" type="hapax" key="vulga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. vulgo</etym>, <sense id="n51413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that makes</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">generally known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a publisher. divulger</hi>: taciti, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Tantalus</hi>, who divulged the secrets of the gods, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulgatus: <entryFree id="n51414" type="main" key="vulga_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of 2. vulgo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51415" type="main" key="vulga_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. vulgo</etym>, <sense id="n51415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making generally known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a publishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divulging</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulgivagus: <entryFree id="n51416" type="main" key="vulgi^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgĭvăgus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vulgus-vagor</etym>, <sense id="n51416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that wanders about everywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rambling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vagrant; inconstant</hi> (Lucretian): <cit><quote lang="la">mos ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:932" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 932</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1071" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1071</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulgo: <entryFree id="n51417" type="main" key="vulgo_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. vulgus <sense id="n51417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51418" type="main" key="vulgo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vulgus</etym>, <sense id="n51418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread among the multitude; to make general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">universal; to put forth to the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi> (cf. publico). </sense><sense id="n51418.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contagium in alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to let all share in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum,</quote> <trans><tr>to publish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 8</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: vulgari cum privatis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to confound one's self with</tr>, <tr>put one's self on a level with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51418.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51418.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make known to all by words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divulge</hi> (cf. promulgo): jurgare coepit dicens, quae facis atque in vulgus vulgat, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 230, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgare aliquem vulgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quod ego vulgari facinus per omnes velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgatur rumor duas deesse tabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec atque talia vulgantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51418.4" n="B" level="2"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">to make common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prostitute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ferarum prope ritu vulgentur concubitus plebis patrumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgato corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretio corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Gent. Rom. 21" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Gent. Rom. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51418.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">bosporon hinc veteres errantis nomine divae Vulgavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:420" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 420</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. d.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common. </hi> </sense><sense id="n51418.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgatissimi sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51418.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51418.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Commonly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">generally known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgatior fama est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 276</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">au)lhtri\s</foreign> illa vulgata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vulgatum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51418.9" n="2" level="3"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgatissimae meretrices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis navis umquam in flumine publico tam volgata omnibus quam istius aetas fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:27:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 27, 59</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgātē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">notoriously; comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 6</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
vulgus: <entryFree id="n51419" type="main" key="vulgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n51419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, Att., Sisenn., and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 230, 27 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:920" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 920</bibl> et saep.) [Sanscr. várga, a group], <hi rend="ital">the great mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi> (class.; cf.: plebs, turba). </sense><sense id="n51419.1" n="I" level="1"> In <pb n="2016" /> <cb n="VULN" /> gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">non est consilium in vulgo, non ratio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in vulgus gratum esse sentimus,</quote> <trans><tr>with the people</tr>, <tr>with the public</tr>, <tr>generally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vulgus notus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 26</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 93 al.: apio gratia in vulgo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 11, 44, § 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51419.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n51419.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throng</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi> of persons or animals: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patronorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insipientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densum (umbrarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inane (animarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:554" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femineum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incautum (ovium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequoreum,</quote> <trans><tr>of sea-monsters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 957" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 957</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51419.4" n="B" level="2"> With an accessory idea of contempt, <hi rend="ital">the crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the vulgar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rabble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">populace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis judicium a judicio vulgi discrepat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:53:198" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 53, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri omnes strenui, boni, nobiles atque ignobiles, vulgus fuimus sine gratiā, sine auctoritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam ad vulgum quaesierat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid oportet Nos facere, a vulgo longe lateque remotos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odi profanum vulgus et arceo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malignum Spernere vulgus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:123" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 123</bibl></cit>: fani pulchritudo et vetustas Praenestinarum etiam nunc retinet sortium nomen: atque id in vulgus; <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim magistratus aut quis vir illustrior utitur sortibus?</quote> <trans><tr>among the common people</tr>, <tr>among the populace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargere voces In volgum ambiguas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio pane procerum, alio volgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus proceresque gemunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 526</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51419.5" n="C" level="2"> Militari gratiora vulgo, <hi rend="ital">the common soldiery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo militum acceptior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vulgō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volg-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">abl. adv.</hi>, prop. among the multitude; hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">before every body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before all the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">universally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publicly</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">palam, publice, aperte): num locum ad spectandum dare? aut ad prandium invitare? Minime, sed vulgo, passim. Quid est vulgo? Universos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi tempus erat, ut homines vulgo impune occiderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo totis castris testamenta obsignabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidit, ut vulgo milites ab signis discederent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo nascetur amomum,</quote> <trans><tr>everywhere</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituli volgo moriuntur in herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo loquebantur, Antonium mansurum esse Casilini,</quote> <trans><tr>generally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid vulgo ostendere ac proferre,</quote> <trans><tr>before all the world</tr>, <tr>openly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (litteras) vulgo ad te mitto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum illud verbum est, vulgo quod dici solet, Omnes, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>usually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vulgo uti solemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quod vulgo sententias vocamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victum vulgo quaerere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by prostitution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo concepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulnerabilis: <entryFree id="n51420" type="main" key="vulne^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnĕrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voln-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vulnero</etym>, <sense id="n51420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injurious</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:section=171" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, § 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulnerarius: <entryFree id="n51421" type="main" key="vulne^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnĕrārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voln-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vulnus</etym>, <sense id="n51421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to wounds.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51421.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum,</quote> <trans><tr>a plaster for wounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 40, § 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:114" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 11, 27, § 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51421.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surgeon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 6, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulneratio: <entryFree id="n51422" type="main" key="vulne^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnĕrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voln-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vulnero</etym>, <sense id="n51422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wound.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51422.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 16, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:47" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51422.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an injuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae, salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulnerator: <entryFree id="n51423" type="main" key="vulne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnĕrātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voln-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wounder;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">an injurer</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">gentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 14, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulnero: <entryFree id="n51424" type="main" key="vulne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voln-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vulnus</etym>, <sense id="n51424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hurt</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">injure</hi> by a wound (syn.: saucio, ferio). </sense><sense id="n51424.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu quis quem prius vulneret, quam illum interfectum viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cotta legatus in adversum os fundā vulneratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 35</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerosque jacula tormentis aut manu emissa vulnerabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 57, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acie ipsā et ferri viribus vulnerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus vulneratum ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aper) vulnerat armentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 372</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. of part affected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse volneratus umerum, femur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51424.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: Romanorum duae naves fractae sunt, vulneratae<cb n="VULP" />  aliquot, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 30, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis ictibus vulnerata navis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythicorum (smaragdorum) tanta duritia est, ut non queant vulnerari,</quote> <trans><tr>cannot be injured</tr>, <tr>defaced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 16, § 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51424.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virorum hoc animos vulnerare posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laesus ac vulneratus reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravior ne nuntius aures Vulneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 583</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnerant aures eorum praecepta continentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(amor) mea vulnerat arcu Pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae vulneror ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 7, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimine vulnerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18</bibl></cit> (19), 105.</sense></entryFree>
vulnifer: <entryFree id="n51425" type="main" key="vulni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnĭfer</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voln-</orth>), <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vulnus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n51425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wound-bringing</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 173</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Maxim.</author> Gall. 5, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulnifico: <entryFree id="n51426" type="main" key="vulni^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wound</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. Fort. Misc. 10, 2.</sense></entryFree>
vulnificus: <entryFree id="n51427" type="main" key="vulni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnĭfĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voln-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vulnus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n51427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wound-making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wound-inflicting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wounding</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:504" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chalybs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum (i. e. caestus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:420" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulnus: <entryFree id="n51428" type="main" key="vulnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voln-</orth>), <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root vul-; cf. vultur; akin to vello</etym>, <sense id="n51428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wound</hi> (cf.: ictus, cicatrix). </sense><sense id="n51428.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave faxit volnus tibi jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui abstergerem volnera?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus in latere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis et illatis et acceptis vulneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudicare ex vulnere ob rem publicam accepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui infligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 21, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneribus defessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravi vulnere ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneribus confectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 26, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego factum modo vulnus habebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile ex volnere est recreatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51428.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">a wound</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a hole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crack</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">vulneribus donec paulatim evicta (ornus) supremum Congemuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 630</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 383</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:247" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 286</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51428.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defeat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae gravissimo percussus vulnere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tam gravi vulnere etiam illa, quae consanuisse videbantur, recrudescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae hic rei publicae vulnera imponebat, eadem ille sanabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera imposita provinciae sanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inusta rei publicae (with scelera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vulnus super vulnus, sed multiplex clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 54, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—Esp., in the phrase vulnus accipere, <hi rend="ital">to be defeated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suffer great loss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:19" default="NO">2, 11, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 42, 4, 10</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">pain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 639</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 426</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">wounds</hi> of love, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 22</bibl> (3, 15), 7; 2, 25 (3, 20), 46; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 11, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcia vulnera sagittae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 156, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulnusculum: <entryFree id="n51429" type="main" key="vulnusculum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulnusculum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">voln-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vulnus</etym>, <sense id="n51429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slight wound</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:1:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 1, § 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 112, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulpecula: <entryFree id="n51430" type="main" key="vulpe_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulpēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vulpes</etym>, <sense id="n51430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little fox</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. Carm. Phil. 59: tum vulpecula evasit puteo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulpes: <entryFree id="n51431" type="main" key="vulpes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulpes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volp-</orth>), <itype>is</itype> (collat. form, <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vulpis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> 40, 7</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)lw/phc</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n51431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fox.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51431.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 186</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51431.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">craftiness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi sub vulpe latentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 437</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:117" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 117</bibl>.—Prov. </sense><sense id="n51431.3" n="a" level="4"> Jungere vulpes, for any absurd or impossible undertaking, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51431.4" n="b" level="4"> Vulpes pilum mutat, non mores, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51431.5" n="c" level="4"> Tam facile, quam pirum vulpes comest, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51431.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: vulpes marina, <hi rend="ital">a kind of shark</hi>: Squalus alopecia, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 43, 67, § 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulpinor: <entryFree id="n51432" type="main" key="vulpi_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulpīnor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volp-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n51432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [vulpinus], <hi rend="ital">to play the fox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be sly as a fox</hi> (anteand post-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 46, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulpinus: <entryFree id="n51433" type="main" key="vulpi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulpīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vulpes</etym>, <sense id="n51433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a fox</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 47, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 13, 55, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 5, 16, § 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulpio: <entryFree id="n51434" type="hapax" key="vulpi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulpĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volp-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one</hi> <cb n="VULT" /> <hi rend="ital">cunning as a fox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sly fox</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 328, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulpis: <entryFree id="n51435" type="main" key="vulpis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulpis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. vulpes <sense id="n51435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vulsella: <entryFree id="n51436" type="main" key="vulsella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulsella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. volsella.</entryFree>
vulsinii: <entryFree id="n51437" type="main" key="Vulsi^ni^i_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulsĭnĭī</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulsĭnĭenses</orth>, v. Volsinii.</entryFree>
vulsio: <entryFree id="n51438" type="main" key="vulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vello</etym>, <sense id="n51438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plucking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulso: <entryFree id="n51439" type="main" key="Vulso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vols-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen in the Manlian</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">Manlius Vulso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:59" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulsura: <entryFree id="n51440" type="hapax" key="vulsu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulsūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vols-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vello</etym>, <sense id="n51440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plucking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pulling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulsus: <entryFree id="n51441" type="main" key="vulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of vello.</entryFree>
vulticulus: <entryFree id="n51442" type="hapax" key="vulti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vultĭcŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volt-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vultus</etym>, a <sense id="n51442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mien</hi>, <hi rend="ital">air</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non te Bruti nostri vulticulus ab istā oratione deterret?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>severe look</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vultum: <entryFree id="n51443" type="main" key="vultum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vultum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. vultus <sense id="n51443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vultuosus: <entryFree id="n51444" type="main" key="vultu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vultŭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vultus</etym>, <sense id="n51444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of an expressive countenance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of airs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grimaces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grimacing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affected</hi>: homo, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 171: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid ineptum aut vultuosum sit (in oratione),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:183" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vultur: <entryFree id="n51445" type="main" key="vultur1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vultur</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volt-</orth>), <itype>ŭris</itype> (ante-class. collat. form of the <sense id="n51445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vultŭrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volt-</orth>), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 120</bibl> P.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 683</bibl> ib.; and id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 597</bibl>, or Ann. v. 141 Vahl.), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a vulture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51445.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 6, 7, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 597</bibl>.—As a bird of omen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultur profert cornua, for something impossible,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 352</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n51445.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, a designation of a grasping, avaricious person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:43" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:62:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 62, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n51446" type="main" key="Vultur2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vultur</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Volt-</orth>), <itype>ŭris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Apulia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Venusia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monle Vulture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 185</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulturnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Volt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Vultur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <trans><tr>a southeastby-one-third-south wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:65" default="NO">11, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 11</bibl>; App. de Mundo, p. 63, 14.</sense></entryFree>
vulturcius: <entryFree id="n51447" type="main" key="Vulturci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulturcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Volt-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the fellow-conspirators of Catiline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 44, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulturinus: <entryFree id="n51448" type="main" key="vultu^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vultŭrīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. vultur</etym>, <sense id="n51448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a vulture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vulture-like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vulturine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 4, 10, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:28:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <trans><tr>the form of a vulture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulturius: <entryFree id="n51449" type="main" key="vultu^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vultŭrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volt-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n51449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vulture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bird of prey.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51449.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 146</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 680</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 21, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51449.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51449.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vulture;</hi> a designation for <hi rend="ital">a rapacious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">covetous person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an extortioner</hi>, and the like: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt alii qui te volturium vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulturius illius provinciae imperator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51449.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An unlucky throw</hi> at dice: <cit><quote lang="la">jacit vulturios quattuor. Talos arripio: jacto basilicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulturnalis: <entryFree id="n51450" type="main" key="Vulturna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulturnālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Volt-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n51450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the god Vulturnus</hi> (perh. the same as Vertumnus). </sense><sense id="n51450.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: flamen, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 45</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 125 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n51450.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulturnālia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Vulturnus</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
vulturnum: <entryFree id="n51451" type="main" key="Vulturnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulturnum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Volt-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n51451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Vulturnus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castel Volturno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:45" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vulturnus: <entryFree id="n51452" type="main" key="Vulturnus" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulturnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Volt-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n51452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Campania</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Volturno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:729 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 729 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulturnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Volt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Vulturnus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Vulturnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:521" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulturnusventus: <entryFree id="n51453" type="main" key="Vulturnus ventus" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulturnus ventus</orth>, v. 2. Vultur.<sense id="n51453.0" n="3" level="3"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vulturnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the god Vulturnus;</hi> v. Vulturnalis.</sense></entryFree>
vulturus: <entryFree id="n51454" type="main" key="vultu^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vultŭrus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volt-</orth>), v. 1. vultur <sense id="n51454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vultus: <entryFree id="n51455" type="main" key="vultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vultus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volt-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n51455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form, <number>plur.</number> volta, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 230, 15</bibl>, or Ann. v. 536 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1213</bibl>) [etym. dub.; cf. Goth. vulthus, glory], <hi rend="ital">an expression of countenance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the countenance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visage</hi>, as to features and expression; hence, often to be translated by <hi rend="ital">features</hi>, <hi rend="ital">looks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">air</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mien</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aspect</hi> (syn. aspectus). </sense><sense id="n51455.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51455.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <number>sing.</number>: nam et oculi nimis arguti, quemadmodum animo affecti sumus, loquuntur, et is qui appellatur vultus,<pb n="2017" /> <cb n="X" />  qui nullo in animante esse praeter hominem potest, indicat: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus vim Graeci norunt. nomen omnino non habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago animi vultus est, indices oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae nobis non possumus fingere, facies, voltus, sonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi, supercilia, frons, vultus denique totus, qui sermo quidam tacitus mentis est, hic in fraudem homines impulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus atque nutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torvus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tali vultu gemens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui spiritus illi, Qui voltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 649</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voltus tuus, cui regendum me tradidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus mehercule tuos mihi expressit omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficti simulatique vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo severitatem illorum, sed ne vultus quidem ferre possemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere vultus mutantem Protea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super omnia vultus Accessere boni,</quote> <trans><tr>kindly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus modo sumit acerbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51455.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an angry countenance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grim visage</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">(justum virum) Non vultus instantis tyranni Mente quatit solidā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 12</bibl>;
