<bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 20, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">33, 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51455.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n51455.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the face</hi> (syn.: facies, os): simiae vultum subire, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia et vultum teretesque suras laudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petamque vultus umbra curvis unguibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 93</bibl></cit>; so in the <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 217</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 292</bibl>; 6, 630; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:32:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 32, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 2, § 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51455.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a painted face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portrait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus Epicurios per cubicula gestant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 23</bibl>; Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n51455.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus capit illa priores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 738</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque nitentem Inachidos vultus mutaverat ille juvencam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:611" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 611</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">unus erat toto naturae vultus in orbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis placidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 848</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vulva: <entryFree id="n51456" type="main" key="vulva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. volva.</entryFree>
vulvula: <entryFree id="n51457" type="main" key="vulvu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vulvŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. volvula. <cb n="X." /></entryFree>
x: <entryFree id="n51458" type="main" key="X"><orth extent="full" lang="la">X</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">x</orth>, a character probably derived from the Greek <foreign lang="greek">*c</foreign> (this form of that letter being found in some few Greek inscriptions). Though not introduced instead of the characters for the two separate sounds till after the adoption of the alphabet, the letter x is certainly older than the Latin inscriptions known to us; for we find in the Columna rostr., EXEMET MAXIMOS, EXFOCIONT; in the fifth Epitaph of the Scipios, SAXSVM; and in the S. C. de Bacch., EXDEICENDVM, EXDEICATIS. EXTRAD, etc.The sound of X was like that of the Greek <foreign lang="greek">c</foreign>, i. e. <sense id="n51458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ks</hi>, although etymologically it represented not only <hi rend="ital">cs</hi> (as in lux, from luc-s, and dixi, from dic-si), but also <hi rend="ital">gs</hi> (as in lex, from leg-s; rexi, from reg-si); <hi rend="ital">hs</hi> (as in traxi, from trah-si; vexi, from vehsi); and <hi rend="ital">chs</hi> (as in the word onyx, from onych-s, borrowed from the Greek). The hardening of a softer final (<hi rend="ital">g</hi>, <hi rend="ital">h</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ch</hi>) before <hi rend="ital">s</hi> into the <hi rend="ital">c</hi>-sound, which occurs in the last-mentioned cases, is found also in several roots ending in <hi rend="ital">v</hi> and <hi rend="ital">u</hi>: nix for niv-s, vixi for viv-si, connixi for conniv-si, fluxi for fluv-si, from fluo (root FLUV; cf. fluvius), struxi for stru-si. Less frequently x has arisen from the combinations <hi rend="ital">ps</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ts</hi>: proximus for prop-simus (from prope), nixus for nit-sus (from nitor), the latter being used along with the collateral form nisus, as also connivi with connixi, and mistus (from misceo) with mixtus. An exchange of the sounds <hi rend="ital">ss</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">s</hi> and <hi rend="ital">x</hi>, took place in axis for assis, laxus for lassus; cf. also Ulixes, from the Sicilian <foreign lang="greek">*ou)li/chs</foreign>, Etruscan Uluxe for <foreign lang="greek">*)odusseu/s</foreign>; so, too. Sextius, Exquiliae = Sestius, Esquiliae; cf. also Ajax = <foreign lang="greek">*ai)/as</foreign>. In the later language of the vulgar, the guttural sound in <hi rend="ital">x</hi> disappeared, and <hi rend="ital">s</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ss</hi> was often written for it; as vis for vix. vixit for visit. unsit for unxit, conflississet for conflixisset, in late Inscrr. (v. Corss. Ausspr. I. p. 297 sq.); hence regularly in Italian, and frequently in the <cb n="XENO" /> other Romance tongues, the Lat. <hi rend="ital">x</hi> is represented by <hi rend="ital">s</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ss.</hi> Respecting the nature of <hi rend="ital">x</hi> in composition, v. ex.By a mere graphic variation, one of the constituent sounds of <hi rend="ital">x</hi> is often expressed in inscriptions (but not the earliest, v. Corss. Ausspr. I. p. 296) by an additional <hi rend="ital">c</hi> or <hi rend="ital">s;</hi> as SACXO or SAXSO for saxo; VCXOR or VXSOR for uxor; CONIVNCX or CONIVNXS for conjux; even both sounds are sometimes thus expressed, VICXSIT for vixit.As an abbreviation X stands for decem, <hi rend="ital">ten;</hi> it was stamped upon the silver denarius, so called because it was valued at ten asses.</sense></entryFree>
xanthicus: <entryFree id="n51459" type="main" key="Xanthi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xanthĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (sc. mensis), <sense id="n51459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Macedonian name of a month which corresponded to the Roman</hi> Aprilis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xanthippe: <entryFree id="n51460" type="main" key="Xanthippe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xanthippē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*canqi/pph</foreign>, <sense id="n51460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Socrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xanthippus: <entryFree id="n51461" type="main" key="Xanthippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xanthippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ca/nqippos</foreign>. <sense id="n51461.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The father of Pericles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 44</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n51461.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Lacedœmonian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who took Regulus prisoner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xantho: <entryFree id="n51462" type="main" key="Xantho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xantho</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*canqw/</foreign>, <sense id="n51462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Nereus and Doris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 336</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xanthos: <entryFree id="n51463" type="greek" key="xanthos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xanthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ca/nqos</foreign>, <sense id="n51463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a golden color</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xanthus: <entryFree id="n51464" type="main" key="Xanthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xanthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ca/nqos</foreign>, <sense id="n51464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several rivers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n51464.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Troas</hi>, confounded by many with the Scamander, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 103, 106, § 230</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 473</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 634 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 245</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 646</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51464.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Lycia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near a town of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Essenide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 28, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:214" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 34, 39, § 214</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51464.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small stream in Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 350</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xeniades: <entryFree id="n51465" type="main" key="Xe^nia^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xĕniădes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*cenia/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n51465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Corinthian who purchased and liberated Diogenes the Cynic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:18:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 18, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xeniolum: <entryFree id="n51466" type="main" key="xe^ni^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xĕnĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>xenium</etym>, <sense id="n51466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small gift</hi> or <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xenium: <entryFree id="n51467" type="greek" key="xe^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xĕnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ce/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n51467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gift</hi> or <hi rend="ital">present made to a guest</hi> (pure Lat. lautia). </sense><sense id="n51467.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>.—Hence, Xenia, <hi rend="ital">the title of the thirteenth book of Martial's epigrams</hi>, because treating of such things as were usually presented to guests, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51467.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a gift. present</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 20, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xeno: <entryFree id="n51468" type="main" key="Xe^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xĕno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ce/nwn</foreign>, <sense id="n51468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Epicurean philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1, 1</bibl>; 13, 37, 1.</sense></entryFree>
xenocles: <entryFree id="n51469" type="main" key="Xe^nocles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xĕnocles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*cenoklh=s</foreign>, <sense id="n51469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rhetorician of Adramytteum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xenocrates: <entryFree id="n51470" type="main" key="Xe^no^cra^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xĕnŏcrătes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*cenokra/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n51470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disciple of Plato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born at Chalcedon in the 95th Olympiad</hi>, B. C. 400, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:18:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 18, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51470.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sculptor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Tisicrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and author of works on sculpture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51470.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A writer on the art of painting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xenodochium: <entryFree id="n51471" type="greek" key="xe^no^do^chi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xĕnŏdŏchīum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">cenodoxei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n51471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public building for the reception of strangers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a caravansary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stranger's hospital</hi> (syn. deversorium), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 35</bibl>. —Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">xĕnōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 19 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
xenodochus: <entryFree id="n51472" type="greek" key="xe^no^do^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xĕnŏdŏchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">cenodo/xos</foreign>, <sense id="n51472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who receives strangers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a superintendent of the stranger's hospital</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 8, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
xenon: <entryFree id="n51473" type="main" key="xe^no_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xĕnōn</orth>, v. xenodochium.</entryFree>
xenoparochus: <entryFree id="n51474" type="greek" key="xe^no^pa^ro^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xĕnŏpărŏchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">cenopa/roxos</foreign>, <sense id="n51474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who attends to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provides for strangers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xenophanes: <entryFree id="n51475" type="main" key="Xe^no^pha^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xĕnŏphănes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*cenofa/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n51475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Greek philosopher of Colophon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born about</hi> B. C. 556, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Archelous</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 23, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xenophilus: <entryFree id="n51476" type="main" key="Xe^no^phi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xĕnŏphĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ceno/filos</foreign>, <sense id="n51476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pythagorean philosopher and musician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 13</bibl>, ext. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:50:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51</bibl> § 168.</sense></entryFree>
xenophon: <entryFree id="n51477" type="main" key="Xe^no^phon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xĕnŏphon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*cenofw=n</foreign>, <sense id="n51477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebratea Greek historian and philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born</hi> B. C. 445, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Socrates and a leader of the Greeks in the army of Cyrus</hi> <cb n="XYST" /> <hi rend="ital">the younger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Xĕnŏphontēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*cenofo/nteios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Xenophon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Xenophontian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>mentioned in his writings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
xerampelinae: <entryFree id="n51478" type="greek" key="xe_rampe^li^nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xērampĕlĭnae</orth>, ārum. <gen>f.</gen> (sc. vestes), = <foreign lang="greek">chrampelinai</foreign> (of the color of dry vineleaves), <sense id="n51478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark-red</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dark-colored clothes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:519" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 519</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xeranticus: <entryFree id="n51479" type="greek" key="xe_ranti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xērantĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">chrantiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n51479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drying</hi>: decoctio, Macer, 1, 88; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xerocollyrium: <entryFree id="n51480" type="greek" key="xe_ro^colly_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xērŏcollȳrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">chrokollu/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n51480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dry salve</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xerolophus: <entryFree id="n51481" type="main" key="Xe_ro^lo^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xērŏlŏphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*chro/lofos</foreign> (prop. Dry Hill), <sense id="n51481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a place in Byzantium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:18:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 347</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
xeromyrrha: <entryFree id="n51482" type="main" key="xe_ro^myrrha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xērŏmyrrha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">chro/s-mu/rra</foreign>), <sense id="n51482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dry myrrh</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Hymn. 2, 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xerophagia: <entryFree id="n51483" type="greek" key="xe_ro^pha^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xērŏphăgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">chrofagi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n51483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the eating of dry food</hi>: xerophagias observare, Tert. adv Psych. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
xerophthalmia: <entryFree id="n51484" type="greek" key="xe_rophthalmi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xērophthalmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">chrofqalmi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n51484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dry soreness of the eyes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inflammation of the eyes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8, 3</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 29</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
xerxes: <entryFree id="n51485" type="main" key="Xerxes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xerxes</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Xerses</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 26</bibl>), is (i, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ce/rchs</foreign>, <sense id="n51485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the celebrated king of Persia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Darius Hystaspis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanquished by the Greeks at Salamis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xiphias: <entryFree id="n51486" type="greek" key="xi^phi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xĭphĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">cifi/as</foreign> (swordshaped). <sense id="n51486.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sword-fish</hi>: Xiphias gladius, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 6, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:97" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 97</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n51486.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sword-shaped comet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xiphion: <entryFree id="n51487" type="greek" key="xi^phi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xĭphĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">cifi/on</foreign>, <sense id="n51487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sword-flag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gladiole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 88, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xuthus: <entryFree id="n51488" type="main" key="Xu_thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xūthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*cou=qos</foreign>, <sense id="n51488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Helen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandson of Deucalion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of a branch of the Hellenic nation</hi>, T. Mam. Syll. 884.</sense></entryFree>
xyline: <entryFree id="n51489" type="main" key="Xy^li^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xylĭnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">culi/nh</foreign>): <sense id="n51489.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Xyline come,</quote> <trans><tr>a village in Pamphylia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
xylinum: <entryFree id="n51490" type="greek" key="xy^li^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xylĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">cu/linon</foreign>, <sense id="n51490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cotton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xylobalsamum: <entryFree id="n51491" type="greek" key="xy^lo^balsa^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xylŏbalsămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">culoba/lsamon</foreign>, <sense id="n51491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">balsam-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the wood of the balsamtree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 1, 2</bibl>, §§ 13, 15; 29, 3, 13, § 56.</sense></entryFree>
xylocassia: <entryFree id="n51492" type="greek" key="xy^lo^cassi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xylŏcassĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">culokassi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n51492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wood of the cassia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cassia-wood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xylocinnamomum: <entryFree id="n51493" type="greek" key="xy^lo^cinna^mo_mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xylŏcinnămōmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">culokinna/mwmon</foreign>, <sense id="n51493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wood of the cinnamonshrub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cinnamon-wood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl>.—Also contracted, <orth extent="full" lang="la">xylŏ-cinnămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 271" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 271</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

xysticus: <entryFree id="n51500" type="greek" key="xysti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xystĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">custiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n51500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> xystus. </sense><sense id="n51500.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanitas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the athletes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n51500.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">xystĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">athletes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 332, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xystilis: <entryFree id="n51501" type="main" key="Xysti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Xystĭlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n51501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
xystum: <entryFree id="n51502" type="main" key="xystum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xystum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v xystus.</entryFree>
xystus: <entryFree id="n51503" type="greek" key="xystus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">xystus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">xystum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">custo/s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">custo/n</foreign>. <sense id="n51503.0" n="I" level="1"> Among the Greeks, <hi rend="ital">a covered portico</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gallery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the athletes exercised in winter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n51503.1" n="II" level="1"> Among the Romans, <hi rend="ital">an open colonnade</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portico</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a walk planted with trees</hi>, etc., for recreation, conversation, philosophic discussion, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira. 3:18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira. 3, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 7, 4</bibl>; 9, 36, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 18</bibl>. <pb n="2018" /> <cb n="ZANC" /> <cb n="Y." /></sense></entryFree>
y: <entryFree id="n51504" type="main" key="Y"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Y</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">y</orth>, <itype>a Greek letter introduced at a late period for words borrowed from the Greek</itype>, the place of the Greek <foreign lang="greek">*u</foreign> being previously filled by U (i. e. V, which graphically originated from <foreign lang="greek">*u</foreign>; v. the letters U and V). Thus, according to the express testimony of Cicero (Or. 48, 160), Ennius always wrote Burrus for Pyrrhus, and Bruges for Phryges; and so the words which were identical in Greek and Latin in the oldest period of the language have either preserved <sense id="n51504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">u</hi> where the Greek has <foreign lang="greek">u</foreign>, as bucina and <foreign lang="greek">buka/nh</foreign>, cubus and <foreign lang="greek">ku/bos</foreign>, fuga and <foreign lang="greek">fugh/</foreign>, mus and <foreign lang="greek">mu=s</foreign> et saep.; or this <hi rend="ital">u</hi> has given place to <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, as in lacrima, formerly lacruma, = <foreign lang="greek">da/kruma</foreign>. Sometimes, also, <hi rend="ital">o</hi> took the place of the <foreign lang="greek">u</foreign>; cf. mola and <foreign lang="greek">mu/lh</foreign>, sorex and <foreign lang="greek">u(/rac</foreign>, folium and <foreign lang="greek">fu/llon</foreign>, and, shortening a long vowel, ancŏra and <foreign lang="greek">a)/gkura</foreign>, like lacrĭma and <foreign lang="greek">da/kru=ma</foreign>. In Cicero's time <hi rend="ital">y</hi> seems to have been already in use; but its application was restricted to foreign words, and hence the spellings Sylla, Tybris, pyrum, satyra, etc., are to be rejected. <cb n="Z." /></sense></entryFree>
z: <entryFree id="n51505" type="main" key="Z"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Z</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">z</orth>, <itype>was perhaps a letter of the original Latin alphabet, since it is found in the Carmen Saliare</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 26</bibl> Müll.; and in a Latin record of an Oscan law of the time of the Gracchi, C. I. L. 1, 197; but it had long disappeared, when, in Cicero's time, it again came into use, but only in transcribing Greek names, to represent the Greek <foreign lang="greek">*z, z</foreign>, which had previously been represented, when initial, by <sense id="n51505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">s</hi>, as in Saguntum for <foreign lang="greek">*za/kunqos</foreign>, Sethus, sona, etc.; and by <hi rend="ital">ss</hi> when medial, as in Atticisso, badissas, etc., in Plautus. It seems to have been sounded like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">z</hi> (Corss. Ausspr. 1, p. 295; but cf. Roby, Gr. 1, § 195). In late Latin writings <hi rend="ital">z</hi> is very frequent in place of <hi rend="ital">s</hi>, and in the words Zmyrna for Smyrna, zmaragdus for smaragdus, is found in the best MSS. In writings of the third and fourth Christian centuries <hi rend="ital">z</hi> often stands for initial <hi rend="ital">di</hi> before a vowel, as zaconus, zabulus, etc.; cf. the Æolic <foreign lang="greek">za/</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">dia/</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
zabulon: <entryFree id="n51506" type="main" key="Za^bu^lo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Zăbŭlōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*zaboulw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n51506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the tribes of Israel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 441</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
zabulus: <entryFree id="n51507" type="main" key="Za_bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Zābŭlus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Zābŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*za/bolos</foreign> (collat. form of <foreign lang="greek">*dia/bolos</foreign>; cf. the letter D <sense id="n51507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the Devil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
zacharias: <entryFree id="n51508" type="main" key="Zacha^ri_as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Zachărīas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n51508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">i</hi> short, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. zacynthius: <entryFree id="n51509" type="main" key="Za^cynthi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Zăcynthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Zacynthus.</entryFree>
zacynthus: <entryFree id="n51510" type="main" key="Za^cynthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Zăcynthus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*za/kunqos</foreign>, <sense id="n51510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ionian Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Zante</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Zacyntho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:87 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 87 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Zăcynthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Zacynthus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Zacynthian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calchas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bitumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 178</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
zaleucus: <entryFree id="n51511" type="main" key="Za^leucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Zăleucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*za/leukos</foreign>, <sense id="n51511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lawgiver of the Locrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
zama: <entryFree id="n51512" type="main" key="Za^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Zăma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*za/ma</foreign>. <sense id="n51512.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small town in Numidia</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Zamra</hi>), <hi rend="ital">celebrated for the victory gained there by Scipio over Hannibal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:261 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 261 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n51512.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another town in Numidia</hi>, also, with the addition regia, <hi rend="ital">the residence of Juba</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Jama</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 57 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 57 sq.</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 91; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 364, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Zămensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Zama</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Zama</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 30</bibl></cit> (al. Ziamensis). —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Zămenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Zama</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 92.</sense></entryFree>

zancle: <entryFree id="n51516" type="main" key="Zancle_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Zanclē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*za/gklh</foreign>, <sense id="n51516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an older name of the city of Messana</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Messina</hi>), <hi rend="ital">in Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 290</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:662" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 662</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n51516.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Zanclaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Zancle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Zanclean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 729</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n51516.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Zanclēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Zancle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Zanclean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Messana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:48" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
